name: Washington Trust Bancorp, Inc.
description: Washington Trust Bancorp, Inc. is a publicly traded bank holding company headquartered in Westerly, Rhode Island. Founded in 1800, it is one of the oldest community banks in the United States and has a long tradition of serving clients in New England. The company operates through its wholly-owned subsidiary, The Washington Trust Company, which provides a wide range of financial services including personal and commercial banking, wealth management, and mortgage lending. Washington Trust is committed to building lasting relationships with its clients by delivering exceptional service and tailored financial solutions. The bank focuses on enhancing the economic vitality of the communities it serves, offering innovative products and services designed to meet the unique needs of individuals and businesses. With a strong emphasis on community involvement, Washington Trust actively participates in local initiatives and charitable causes. Its mission is to empower customers while ensuring financial stability and growth through sound banking practices. The company has received numerous accolades for its customer service, financial performance, and commitment to community engagement, making it a trusted partner for banking needs in the region.

seo.meta_title: Washington Trust Bancorp, Inc. | Community Banking & Financial Services
seo.meta_description: Explore Washington Trust Bancorp, Inc., a leading community bank offering a wide range of banking and financial services in New England. Learn more about our commitment to customer satisfaction and community involvement.

faq.question: What services does Washington Trust offer?
faq.answer: Washington Trust offers personal banking, commercial banking, mortgage lending, and wealth management services.

faq.question: Who is the CEO of Washington Trust?
faq.answer: Edward O. Handy, III is the CEO of Washington Trust Bancorp, Inc.

faq.question: Where is Washington Trust headquartered?
faq.answer: Washington Trust is headquartered in Westerly, Rhode Island, USA.
